Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 45th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1975...
Injured on 5/31/1975 with a Fractured Hand, out for 3 weeks...
Had first career hit on 9/8/1976, off Pedro Segarra (Min)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/11/1978, off Alfred Lambeth (MAN)...
Traded from New Jersey to Plum Grove on 7/30/1979 (Going to PG: 3B W. Albritton. Going to NJ: P E. Urbina, P T. Soto)...
Injured on 4/18/1984 with a Blister On Finger, out for 6 days...
Injured on 6/3/1984 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by New Jersey on 2/1/1985 to a 2-year deal worth $413,400 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1986, hitting .563 with 0 HR, 6 RBI...
Traded from New Jersey to Halifax on 2/1/1987 (Going to HAL: 3B W. Albritton. Going to NJ: CF M. Hebron, 2B E. Hockman, P D. Martinez)...
Injured on 5/10/1987 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 4-5 weeks...
